body:
https://golang.org/ref/spec#Declarations_and_scope

> The blank identifier may be used like any other identifier in a declaration, but it does not introduce a binding and thus is not declared.

Writing "func \_() {}" is valid, but does not declare a function.  That's why you can't call it as "\_()".

Just like writing "var \_ I = T{}" doesn't declare a variable named "\_".

The spec also explicitly says [PackageName can't be "\_"](https://golang.org/ref/spec#Package_clause).

I don't see a bug here.
